instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_LSOC_RST_L: What is SMC_LSOC_RST_L? SMC_LSOC_RST_L is a signal that comes out of the trackpad on Macbook Airs that can reset the SMC.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message:
Hello again ?
I think i just have another Memory issue.
The MBP boots completly after trying it many attempts. It powers on but there is no backlight or display. When it is able to boot it crashes after few minutes (see picture) freezing and faulty display. 
So i think it is the VRAM, am i correct? [ATTACH type="full"]59619[/ATTACH]
Is there a way to find out which of the Chips is failing?

Thank you and best regards

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message:
Could be GPU too.
What happens if you boot with external monitor connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message: Can test it on monday. Have to wait for the delivery of an USB-C adapter. What do you expect to see on the external screen? If it boots normally on the external?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message: But it seems not to boot when it shows black screen. Bo USB activity and no light when pressing the shift key

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message:
You must see if the problem appears on iGPU, or discrete GPU.
Once external monitor is connected, discrete GPU is automatically enabled.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message:
So i got a adapter now and tested it with an external monitor.
It's getting always harder to boot (more attempts needed) and most of the times it boots with full fan spin and no display and no backlight- independent from trying it with external monitor or without ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message: Start in Diagnostic Mode and check the reported errors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message:
Already did that earlier - no errors occurred. 
When i'm lucky with external monitor backlight shows up but no signal on external and black screen on internal display.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message: So tried it for 1 hour to get into diagnostic mode. Most of the time no USB activity, no backlight and no display. Sometimes it started with usb activity and backlight, freezing in black screen (usb activit stopped) and shutting down after few seconds. 1 time i successfully started diagnostic mode but trackpad was not working. Now it shows low battery even with PSU connected ??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message:
Maybe corrosion under some BGA chips.
Reball SMC first.
Did you try to start in SMC bypass and safe mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message: Didn't tried to reball the smc yet. But today i was able to boot and it worked without errors until i unplugged the PSU. The MBP mmediately freezed - no trackpad, Touchbar was frozen, etc. The Fan spin was on max all the time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message: If board starts with max fan speed from the first moment, that could be a sign of SMC bypass starting mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message: Yes it's always powering on with max fan spin. Whhat could be the reason for it to start in bypass mode automatically all the time?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message:
Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check if <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is steady high.
Also check <SIGNAL>SMC_LSOC_RST_L</SIGNAL>.
Test the board disconnecting keyboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is always high - even if powered off.
<SIGNAL>SMC_LSOC_RST_L</SIGNAL> also always high even if powered off.
No reaction on triggering <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> manually - independent from keyboard connected or not.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> faulty vram?
threads.message: Try to get it again into macOS and run HWMonitor.
